tasks.task: Prepare and present a webinar on growing culinary herbs for home or agricultural business.
subtasks: Introduce self, gather and share relevant information about personal farming experience (Holly Mabie, Garden Dwellers Farm, North Dakota).
Discuss the benefits of growing herbs and their diverse uses (seasonal, home cooking, market sales, tea, cosmetics, aesthetics).
Explain general growing conditions for herbs (sunlight, soil, fertilizers, container suitability).
Address common myths and practices related to herb care and harvesting (morning/evening harvesting, flowering stages, seasonal harvesting).
Provide tips for long-term success and records-keeping in herb cultivation.
Suggest market strategies for herbs (plant succession, seasonal timing, add-on sales, niche markets).
Offer recommendations for easy-to-grow herbs, considering North Dakota hardiness (basil, sage, thyme, savory, parsley, lemon balm).
Describe various methods of storing and preserving herbs (drying, freezing, creating herb tea and other products).
Provide examples of aesthetic uses and repellent properties of herbs (wreaths, swags, insect repellents) and demonstrate handling techniques.

tasks.task: Provide a question-and-answer session to address viewer inquiries and demonstrate engagement.
subtasks: Answer questions regarding cold frame usage, stevia growth, and cold hardiness.
Offer additional resources and contact information for further inquiries or support.
Introduce self, share experience)**:
Explain benefits)**:
Discuss growing conditions)**:
